attributes.action: act to help prevent the de-professionalisation of the public library service in Hampshire
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Hampshire County Council is proposing to make 40% of its branch librarians redundant. The remaining qualified staff will be stripped of their professional status, with half on much reduced pay. This would, over time, represent the complete de-professionalisation of the service as experienced by Hampshire library users, inevitably resulting in a worse service and unreasonable pressure on remaining staff. 
We believe Hampshire residents deserve a quality service, delivered by quality staff that includes qualified information professionals.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "act to help prevent the de-professionalisation of the public library service in Hampshire."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page13680.asp

Prime Minister's Office
